synopsis.p: Writes files in What's Wrong with my NLP format.

param-doc.name: dependent
param-doc.p: Name of the tuple role that references the dependent. The dependent must be in the layer.

param-doc.name: sentences
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a list of elements with the section as the context element. The result specifies the sentences in the section.

param-doc.name: relationName
param-doc.p: Name of the relation that contains tuples that will be represented as relations.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: This expression is evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as the context element, the module will process the document only if the result is true.

param-doc.name: documentFilter
param-doc.p: Only process document that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: words
param-doc.p: Nme of the layer that contains the tokens.

param-doc.name: sectionFilter
param-doc.p: Process only sections that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: wordForm
param-doc.p: Name of the feature that specifies the word form.

param-doc.name: label
param-doc.p: Name of the tuple feature that specifies the relation label.

param-doc.name: head
param-doc.p: Name of the tuple role that references the head. The head must be in the layer.

param-doc.name: sentence
param-doc.p: Name of the tuple role that references the sentence.

param-doc.name: entities
param-doc.p: Names of layers containing named entities.

param-doc.name: entityType
param-doc.p: Name of the feature of entity annotations containing the named entity type.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
